msbt.message: I was reading a whodunit novel from the library when I found a note sandwiched in between the pages!
I read the note and was shocked. It was the name of a suspect in the novel. Was he the one who did it?
I felt so bitter about the whole thing. So I wrote my own name and stuck it in the book instead, !
I wasn't sure I believed it, so I kept reading the rest of the book. Turned out the note was true, .

In the story, characters were passing secret messages they'd put inside of a book, so this got my attention I know it sounds silly now, but I was disappointed that all I'd found was someone's to-do list, .
I read the note. It said, "Balloons won't break from a mosquito bite." Seriously weird, . I got so caught up in wondering why someone would write that, I couldn't concentrate on my book anymore.
The note read, "Penguins don't get frostbite." Was that true? I felt like I should know, I asked , who was sitting right by me.Neither of us knew, but we decided to just sort of let the mystery be.
I like baking cake.
It's great with milk tea, but I always eat too much of it, .Since I'm the one baking the cakes, I can't resist. It's kind of a problem

But if I just keep making the same thing again and again, I think I might get tired of eating That's why I want to try my idea for a fortune-telling cake, with paper fortunes baked inside of it. You'll have to come over and try some, assuming I can make my recipe work, !
I love making fresh-squeezed juice too, .Lately, I've been researching lots of delicious-sounding recipes!The next time I try one out, I hope you can be my taste tester!

I want to try to master knitting.I didn't know what I was doing at first, but the more time I put in, the more it relaxed me Crafting just suits me, somehow And knitting makes everything feel soft and snuggly, .
Lately I've been working on getting better at my knitting, .I started by making a scarf for one of my favorite stuffed animals, but I think it came out too long. It just kind of piles up around her

One of my hobbies lately is knitting. I made a simple coaster, and it came in handy for preventing water stains! That got me to knit more, but I got a little carried away. Now I have more coasters than glasses, !
I like to write things by hand as much as possible.

I know everything's gone digital, but I still feel like analog ways have their own charm, . Just writing down the time and date for some event in my pocket diary makes me more excited about it! Looking through all my old diaries is fun too I treasure all of them!

I've read not many professionals use written day planners anymore. I guess I can understand why.They can be bulky and awkward, but I've found a few that are more compact and convenient to use. Really, the best thing would be if I was just able to keep my schedule memorized, !
I love writing tools! Just looking at them on the shelf in the store gets me dreaming up things to write
I like to collect fountain pens, so I have a lot to choose from!There's something about running a pen tip across paper with buttery smooth ink,

The latest writing tools come with all kinds of features, so there's bound to be one for just about anyone For me, there was that one special pencil, the one that made me care about what I use to write with. The softness of the graphite in that pencil made writing feel so good , it was inspiring!
High-end writing tools can get really expensive. You're probably better off not being obsessed like me.One time, I bought a really stylish ballpoint pen that cost something like 50,000 Bells,

I'm sorry, , I just have to ask you if it's trueWere you really a huge superstar, with a string of hits?Did you come here to escape it all?No, wait—you don't have to blow your cover. It's honestly none of my business. I'm sorry for asking

Ever since we met, I've felt like I knew your face from somewhere, I remember now!You were on the cover of Hobby Life once, for a feature article all about your process of ! I'm right, aren't I?<10_4 /> I'm not? Oh noUm, can we pretend I never asked?
Oh, that reminds me! I had the craziest dream last nightand you were there, !

From what I remember, you and I were competing in an all-star tournament. It was crazy intense. You won, but not before breaking your signature racket. Then I made three million Bells in the stalk market. It was a weird dream.

We were hanging out at this global festival and one of the bands asked us to get up onstage. No one was more surprised than me when I started for the crowd's entertainment. Dream me is so accomplished.
You and I were about to embark on a road trip, orwere we on a boat?I've completely forgotten! Isn't it funny how the memory of a dream can just vanish in an instant?
It's easy to forget to appreciate yourself—to ignore what you most like seeing in the mirror

For me, I think it's my fluffiness.Even thoughI've heard someone say that all my fluff is why I stay inside a lot, especially in summer.But you and I know that's not why. I just enjoy staying inside, !
For me, I feel certain that it's my hair. I really do.I spend a little bit of time taking good care of it every day.Then again, I do think of hair care as more science than simply style, !
Is it my hooves? I think so.I feel a bit shy about saying it But why not? My hooves are really nice, !
I'll come right out and say it I like my ears, !Ear care is, for me, as important as hair care is for others. Pretty interesting, right?
It's my tail. How couldn't I be happy with it? It's just how it is when you have one.But a tail also meansI'm a little wary of doors. It's a skill, keeping my tail out of trouble, .
I'm pretty sure it's my tail—the way it curls!I hope that wasn't too much just now. We should all like our curls if we have them, .
It's my tail. I mean, look at the way it helps me keep my balance!We all need something to help us like that, .
But I think what I'd sayis that I just like seeing me in the mirror.Every day, we all get a little bit better at being us, .
It's lovely to have a goal, don't you think? I'm hoping to run faster, so I've been asking around for advice.

One idea was to load up the finish line with .It's a nice thought, but I don't think that would work as well for me as it does for .I'm not sure it would be so fun to eat after running either. Oh well! If you have any advice, please let me know.

As an experiment, I tried running with some gentle yet persistent pushing from .Not to complain, but that big sweetheart refused to push me very hard at all.It looked like we were "out for a pleasant stroll," according to .Oh well! If you have any other ideas, I'm all ears, .

One idea was to read my lap times in front of everyone whenever I fall short of my goal.It's certainlyan idea. But honestly, I'd be way too embarrassed to do something like that.So it's back to the drawing board! If you think of anything, please let me know, .
